prompt: Generate me a question on the topic of Maclaurin series
completion:

Circle your answer.

$$
x \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2} x^{2}} \quad \frac{1}{2} \sin 2 x \quad x \cos x \quad\left(1+x^{3}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}$$

prompt: Generate me a question on the topic of matrices
completion:
Three non-singular square matrices, $\mathbf{A}, \mathbf{B}$ and $\mathbf{R}$ are such that

The matrix $\mathbf{R}$ represents a rotation about the $z$-axis through an angle $\theta$ and

$$\mathbf{B}=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
-\cos \theta & \sin \theta & 0 \\
\sin \theta & \cos \theta & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1
\end{array}\right]$$

(a) Show that $\mathbf{A}$ is independent of the value of $\theta$.

(b) Give a full description of the single transformation represented by the matrix $\mathbf{A}$.

prompt: Generate me a question on the topic of planes in three dimensions
completion:
Three planes have equations

$$\begin{array}{r}
4 x-5 y+z=8 \\
3 x+2 y-k z=6 \\
(k-2) x+k y-8 z=6
\end{array}$$

where $k$ is a real constant.

The planes do not meet at a unique point.

(a) Find the possible values of $k$.

(b) For each value of $k$ found in part (a), identify the configuration of the given planes.

Fully justify your answer, stating in each case whether or not the equations of the planes form a consistent system.

[5 marks]

prompt: Generate me a question on the topic of polynomial equations
completion:
The equation $z^{3}+k z^{2}+9=0$ has roots $\alpha, \beta$ and $\gamma$.

(a) (i) Show that

$$\alpha^{2}+\beta^{2}+\gamma^{2}=k^{2}$$

(ii) Show that

$$\alpha^{2} \beta^{2}+\beta^{2} \gamma^{2}+\gamma^{2} \alpha^{2}=-18 k$$

(b) The equation $9 z^{3}-40 z^{2}+r z+s=0$ has roots $\alpha \beta+\gamma, \beta \gamma+\alpha$ and $\gamma \alpha+\beta$.

(i) Show that

$$k=-\frac{40}{9}$$

(ii) Without calculating the values of $\alpha, \beta$ and $\gamma$, find the value of $s$.

Show working to justify your answer.

prompt: Generate me a question on the topic of spring motion and damping
completion:
In this question use $g=10 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-2}$

A light spring is attached to the base of a long tube and has a mass $m$ attached to the other end, as shown in the diagram.

The tube is filled with oil.

When the compression of the spring is $\varepsilon$ metres, the thrust in the spring is $9 m \varepsilon$ newtons.

The mass is held at rest in a position where the compression of the spring is $\frac{20}{9}$ metres.

The mass is then released from rest. During the subsequent motion the oil causes a resistive force of $6 m v$ newtons to act on the mass, where $v \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}$ is the speed of the mass.

At time $t$ seconds after the mass is released, the displacement of the mass above its starting position is $x$ metres.

Find $x$ in terms of $t$.

[10 marks]
